edu.rit.m2mp.ip
Class IPMulticastChannel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mp.ip.IPMulticastChannel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Channel
public class IPMulticastChannel
extends Object
implements Channel

Class IPMulticastChannel encapsulates a broadcast Channel in the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP) that uses UDP multicast. All M2MP packets are conveyed as UDP datagrams sent to and received from a specified IP multicast address and UDP port number. Every IPMulticastChannel on this IP address and port will receive every M2MP packet transmitted by every other IPMulticastChannel on this IP address and port, effectively implementing a broadcast communication medium.

Because of the way multicasting works, when an IPMulticastChannel's outgoing side sends a packet, its own incoming side may or may not receive that packet. (This behavior depends on the TCP/IP protocol stack's implementation and configuration and has been observed to vary from system to system.) However, an M2MP channel is required not to receive its own outgoing packets. Therefore, the channel looks for incoming packets that were sent by itself and does not pass them on up the protocol stack. Packets sent by other channels are passed on up. (Specifically, the channel keeps a set of the message IDs of the outgoing messages, and if an incoming message has one of those message IDs, the message ID is removed from the set and the incoming message is not passed on up. A message ID is also removed from the set if no incoming message with that ID shows up within 2000 milliseconds.)

M2MP Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Constructor Detail

IPMulticastChannel

public IPMulticastChannel(IPChannelAddress theAddress)
Construct a new IP multicast channel attached to the given IP channel address. The default network interface and the default time to live (1) are used. The channel address’s IP address must be an IP multicast address in the range 224.0.0.0 through 239.255.255.255.

Parameters:
theAddress - IP channel address.
Throws:
NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theAddress is null.

IPMulticastChannel

public IPMulticastChannel(IPChannelAddress theAddress,
                          InetAddress theInterface,
                          int theTTL)
Construct a new IP multicast channel attached to the given IP channel address using the given network interface and the given time to live. The channel address’s IP address must be an IP multicast address in the range 224.0.0.0 through 239.255.255.255.

Parameters:
theAddress - IP channel address.
theInterface - IP address of the network interface through which this channel’s network traffic should flow; or null to use the default network interface. Set this argument to null unless you’re running on a multihomed host and you need to use a specific network interface.
theTTL - Time to live value for this channel’s multicast IP datagrams. Set this argument to 1 unless your multicast network spans multiple segments connected by routers.
Throws:
NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theAddress is null.
IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theTTL is not in the range 1 .. 255.
Method Detail

getAddress

public ChannelAddress getAddress()
Returns this channel’s address. This is the source channel address for packets transmitted via this channel.

Specified by:
getAddress in interface Channel

receivePacket

public ChannelAddress receivePacket(IncomingPacket thePacket)
                             throws IOException
Receive the given M2MP packet via this channel.

Note: This M2MP channel implementation always receives packets from the same place, namely the broadcast medium, and does not distinguish among sources. The returned source address is this channel’s address.

Specified by:
receivePacket in interface Channel
Parameters:
thePacket - M2MP packet to be received.
Returns:
Source channel address of the entity that transmitted thePacket.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
SecurityException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if there is a security manager and it doesn’t allow the operation.

transmitPacket

public void transmitPacket(OutgoingPacket thePacket,
                           ChannelAddress theDestination)
                    throws IOException
Send the given M2MP packet via this channel to the given destination.

Note: This M2MP channel implementation always sends packets to the same place, namely the broadcast medium, and does not distinguish among destinations. theDestination is ignored.

Specified by:
transmitPacket in interface Channel
Parameters:
thePacket - M2MP packet to be sent to theDestination.
theDestination - Where to send thePacket (ignored).
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
SecurityException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if there is a security manager and it doesn’t allow the operation.
